info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 26 at 4:44PM EST until December 27 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Burke County in western North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 438 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to continued showers. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen over the past six hours, with 24-hour totals reaching 3 to 6 inches in many places. An additional one-half to one inch of rain is possible through mid-evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Morganton, Valdese, Salem, Drexel, Glen Alpine, Table Rock, Lake James State Park area, South Mountains State Park, Linville Falls, Lake Rhodhiss vicinity, Oak Hill, and Jonas Ridge. - Flooding continues along Spainhour Road near Oak Hill and Homestead Lane near Glen Alpine. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
